import { motion } from 'framer-motion'; import { Calendar, Zap, Info, ChevronDown } from 'lucide-react'; // Use Zap icon const IntermediateSplit = () => { const containerVariants = { /* ... */ }; const itemVariants = { /* ... */ }; // Use Yellow theme colors const summaryStyles = "flex items-center justify-between w-full p-4 bg-yellow-100 rounded-md cursor-pointer hover:bg-yellow-200 transition-colors group"; const detailsContentStyles = "p-4 pt-2 bg-yellow-50 rounded-b-md"; const iconColor = "text-yellow-600"; const headingColor = "text-yellow-800"; const textColor = "text-yellow-700"; return (

Intermediate Upper/Lower Split

Balance strength and hypertrophy with this 4-day split.

This 4-day Upper/Lower split allows for more focused training per session compared to full body, while still providing good frequency. Arrange days as needed (e.g., Mon/Tue/Thu/Fri).

Day 1: Upper Body

  • Barbell Bench Press: 3 sets x 6-10 reps
  • Barbell Rows: 3 sets x 8-12 reps
  • Incline Dumbbell Press: 3 sets x 10-15 reps
  • Lat Pulldowns: 3 sets x 10-15 reps
  • Overhead Press: 3 sets x 8-12 reps
  • Bicep Curls: 3 sets x 10-15 reps
  • Tricep Pushdowns: 3 sets x 10-15 reps

Day 2: Lower Body

  • Back Squats: 3 sets x 6-10 reps
  • Romanian Deadlifts: 3 sets x 8-12 reps
  • Leg Press: 3 sets x 10-15 reps
  • Leg Extensions: 3 sets x 12-15 reps
  • Hamstring Curls: 3 sets x 12-15 reps
  • Calf Raises: 4 sets x 15-20 reps
  • Ab Crunches/Leg Raises: 3 sets x 15-20 reps
 {/* Repeat for Day 3 (Upper) and Day 4 (Lower), potentially with slight exercise variations */}

Day 3: Upper Body

{/* Add slightly different exercises or rep ranges if desired */}

Repeat Day 1 structure or vary exercises (e.g., Dumbbell Bench, Pull-ups).

Day 4: Lower Body

{/* Add slightly different exercises or rep ranges if desired */}

Repeat Day 2 structure or vary exercises (e.g., Front Squats, Glute Bridges).

Rest Days (3 per week)

Distribute rest days between workout days (e.g., Rest on Wed, Sat, Sun). Focus on recovery.

); }; export default IntermediateSplit;
